name: Breaking Bad
summary: Breaking Bad follows protagonist Walter White, a chemistry teacher who lives in New Mexico with his wife and teenage son who has cerebral palsy. White is diagnosed with Stage III cancer and given a prognosis of two years left to live. With a new sense of fearlessness based on his medical prognosis, and a desire to secure his family's financial security, White chooses to enter a dangerous world of drugs and crime and ascends to power in this world. The series explores how a fatal diagnosis such as White's releases a typical man from the daily concerns and constraints of normal society and follows his transformation from mild family man to a kingpin of the drug trade.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: A high-school chemistry teacher (Bryan Cranston) is diagnosed with a deadly cancer, so he puts his expertise to use and teams with an ex-student (Aaron Paul) to manufacture top-grade crystal meth in hopes of providing for his family after he's gone.

episodes.name: Cat's in the Bag...
episodes.summary: After the accident in the desert, Walter and Jesse need to dispose of the unfortunate mess in their rolling lab of an RV, and Skyler begins to suspect that Walter and Jesse are involved in some mysterious goings-on.

episodes.name: ...and the Bag's in the River
episodes.summary: Walter and Jesse fight about the latter's drug use, so he leaves, forcing Walter to deal with their captive, Krazy-8 (Max Arciniega); Hank uses scared-straight tactics with Walter Jr. when his aunt suspects he's smoking pot; Skyler is furious when Walter stays away from home.

episodes.name: Cancer Man
episodes.summary: Walter announces to the family that he has cancer; the DEA believes there is a new big-time player in the Albuquerque drug business; a depressed Walter takes his anger out on a worthy recipient; Jesse pays a surprise visit to his parents' house.

episodes.name: Gray Matter
episodes.summary: At a birthday party for a successful former science colleague, Walter is offered a job; Jesse tries gaining legitimate employment but winds up back cooking meth, and an inferior kind at that; Skyler assembles the family for an intervention to get Walter to agree to chemotherapy, but he's concerned about quality-of-life issues and their financial difficulties.

episodes.name: Crazy Handful of Nothin'
episodes.summary: Walter, in the throes of his chemotherapy treatment and needing money more than ever, agrees to cook more crystal meth with Jesse; Skinny Pete hooks Jesse up with an important new contact, while the DEA intensifies its investigation of Albuquerque's new drug kingpin.

episodes.name: A No-Rough-Stuff-Type Deal
episodes.summary: Walter and Jesse do business with a new partner-in-crime, but immediately run into "production problems," which necessitates a nearly impossible mission to knock off a chemical-supply house. Meanwhile, Marie throws a baby shower for Skyler and presents her with an unusual gift that shows a different side of the aunt-to-be.

episodes.name: Seven Thirty-Seven
episodes.summary: Season 2 kicks off with Walt and Jesse once again bearing witness to Tuco's incendiary disposition, which leads them to the conclusion that it's time to put an end to their business dealings with him. But the question is how. Meanwhile, Hank serves as a go-between for estranged sisters Skyler and Marie.

episodes.name: Grilled
episodes.summary: Trying to dissociate themselves from the volatile Tuco takes a bad turn when Walt and Jesse get trapped with the dealer, and Skyler, worried about her missing husband, receives comfort from her sister and brother-in-law. Hank, meanwhile, pays a business call on Jesse's mother.

episodes.name: Bit by a Dead Bee
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse attempt to cover their tracks and distance themselves from Tuco, but they soon find that business is taking a hit along with their financial situation. Meanwhile, Hank and his DEA investigation into the meth ring get a major break that just might put Walt and Jesse in their crosshairs.

episodes.name: Down
episodes.summary: Despite Walt's attempt to reconnect with the family, a suspicious Skyler keeps him at arm's length and worries about what he's been up to while he's been away from the house; Jesse finds himself on the streets once again and struggles to improve his lot in life.

episodes.name: Breakage
episodes.summary: Hank deals with some lingering aftereffects from his confrontation with Tuco; bills are piling up at the White house and tensions are beginning to run high; Jesse organizes a crew of dealers to take their product to the streets.

episodes.name: Peekaboo
episodes.summary: Walt returns to teaching at the high school; when Skinny Pete gets taken advantage of and ripped off, Jesse steps in, but bites off more than he can chew; Skyler takes the opportunity to show her appreciation for Gretchen's kindness in picking up the tab for Walt's treatments.

episodes.name: Negro Y Azul
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse contemplate an expansion of their business; Hank experiences a hassle in El Paso as he tries to adapt to his new coworkers; Skyler's new job opportunity leads to her reconnecting with an ex-colleague; and Jesse interacts with his new landlady.

episodes.name: Better Call Saul
episodes.summary: Badger's brush with the law leads Walt and Jesse to call in a shady lawyer; the DEA believes it has a line on the mysterious and elusive "Heisenberg"; Hank's stint in El Paso is up and he returns to Albuquerque, but his mental makeup causes concern for Marie.

episodes.name: 4 Days Out
episodes.summary: After undergoing a PET-CAT scan and fearing the worst, Walt takes lawyer Saul's advice and hunkers down for a marathon session of cooking product; Jesse's romance with his landlady is heating up, but must cool off quickly when he and Walt head for the desert to take care of business.

episodes.name: Over
episodes.summary: The Whites throw a party to thank family and friends for their support through Walt's trying time, but it turns ugly when he and Hank get into a bitter argument; later, a pent-up and fed-up Walt tries to occupy his time with home-improvement projects. Worried about Walt's physical and emotional states, Skyler confides in her boss; Jane keeps her relationship with Jesse a secret from her father.

episodes.name: Mandala
episodes.summary: Saul suggests a new business partner for Walt and Jesse after they begin to lose their dealers to some unforeseen circumstances. At work, Skyler confronts Ted after she uncovers some unnerving information; and Jesse opens up to Jane about what he does for a living, with disastrous results.

episodes.name: Phoenix
episodes.summary: A new addition joins the White family as Walter Jr. attempts to help out his struggling family by launching a new Web site. Elsewhere, Jesse's addiction worsens and his relationship with Jane begins to negatively impact Walt and her father.

episodes.name: ABQ
episodes.summary: In the Season 2 finale, Skyler's frustration with Walt's secrecy boils over; Jesse is dealt a devastating blow that leads him down a path of self-destruction, and only Walt is willing to help him; and a grief-stricken Donald experiences more tragedy.

episodes.name: No Más
episodes.summary: In the third-season premiere, Walt faces a new threat on a new front and deals with an increasingly angry Skyler, who must consider what to do next with her life and the kids'. Meanwhile, Jesse comes face-to-face with some startling self-revelations.

episodes.name: Caballo sin Nombre
episodes.summary: Despite ever-increasing tension between Walt and Skyler, he pulls out all the stops in an effort to reconcile with the family. Elsewhere, Saul is instrumental in getting Jesse involved in a most-unusual investment opportunity.

episodes.name: I.F.T.
episodes.summary: Walt disregards Skyler's demands and the rift between them widens dramatically, pushing her to take even more drastic steps. Meanwhile, continuing anxiety and panic attacks plague Hank, which leads to a serious situation at the Drug Enforcement Agency.

episodes.name: Green Light
episodes.summary: Skyler's latest bit of bad news proves to be a blow to Walt, and his loss of control endangers his job and his business relationships with Saul and Jesse. Hank goes full-speed ahead into the agency's investigation of the blue-meth case, while Jesse cooks up a new plan.

episodes.name: Más
episodes.summary: When Gus intensifies efforts to persuade Walt to get back in the meth business, Jesse takes exception and a rift appears in his and Walt's personal relationship. Meanwhile, Skyler's new relationship isn't turning out as she'd like; and Marie tells Skyler about her concerns for the increasingly troubled Hank and his well-being.

episodes.name: Sunset
episodes.summary: Walt moves into new digs and a distraught Walter Jr. demands to know just where his parents' relationship stands. Meanwhile, Hank's investigation is beginning to hit too close to home for Walt, causing serious concerns for him and Jesse.

episodes.name: One Minute
episodes.summary: Hank's behavior becomes increasingly more unpredictable and volatile, which leads to a confrontation with Jesse and problems at the DEA; Skyler wants Walt to make a deal; and Gus' decisions result in some serious consequences.

episodes.name: I See You
episodes.summary: The White and Schrader families anxiously await word on Hank's condition. Meanwhile, Jesse takes care of business at the lab while Walt tries to make peace with Gus, but after witnessing a terrifying flash of anger, Walt starts to fear for his and his family's lives.

episodes.name: Kafkaesque
episodes.summary: Hank's stay in the hospital is accompanied by some daunting bills, but Skyler thinks she has a way of dealing with them. Meanwhile, some of the problems between Walt and Gus are ameliorated; and Jesse seeks more independence and grabs a profitable opportunity that presents itself.

episodes.name: Fly
episodes.summary: When Walt becomes driven to distraction by a contaminant in the lab, he refuses to cook meth until they are able to get rid of it.

episodes.name: Abiquiu
episodes.summary: Skyler's increased involvement in Walt's business causes him concern; Hank's recovery is plagued by setbacks; and Jesse makes a surprising discovery as he gets more involved in his new enterprise.

episodes.name: Half Measures
episodes.summary: Jesse ignores Walt's advice and finds himself in a dangerous situation. Fearing for Jesse's safety, Walt takes drastic measures to try to put things right. And tragedy strikes following an unexpected confrontation.

episodes.name: Full Measure
episodes.summary: Jesse goes on the lam in the third-season finale. But Mike is right on his heels, so Walt works a deal with Gus and comes up with an unsettling plan that might help guarantee both his and Jesse's safety.

episodes.name: Box Cutter
episodes.summary: In the Season 4 opener, Walt and Jesse are confronted by the life-threatening consequences of their actions. Meanwhile, Skyler contends with a puzzling disappearance, and Marie finds it difficult to help a recovering Hank.

episodes.name: Thirty-Eight Snub
episodes.summary: Walt tries to establish a new alliance as he plots his next move. Meanwhile, Skyler urges Walt to consider a business opportunity that could keep the family safe.

episodes.name: Open House
episodes.summary: Goings-on at Jesse's place start to get out of control; Skyler reluctantly turns to Saul for help; Marie settles back into an old habit; and Hank hears from an old friend who needs assistance.

episodes.name: Bullet Points
episodes.summary: The Cartel makes a power move; Skyler and Walt reveal something embarrassing to the family; and Jesse's misdeeds bring some unwanted attention.

episodes.name: Shotgun
episodes.summary: Jesse's disappearance leaves Walt fearing the worst; Skyler has a surprising reunion; and Hank gives Det. Roberts bad news.

episodes.name: Cornered
episodes.summary: A shocking discovery unsettles Skyler; Walter Jr. leans on his father to make a special purchase; Mike gets surprise help from Jesse.

episodes.name: Problem Dog
episodes.summary: A frustrated Walt takes on a risky gamble; Skyler encounters problems with her latest business venture; Hank requires Walter Jr.'s services for an unusual reason.

episodes.name: Hermanos
episodes.summary: Skyler devises a plan to cure her money woes; Hank recruits Walt to help him work out a theory, while Walt grows impatient with Jesse.

episodes.name: Bug
episodes.summary: Mistakes from Skyler's past prove to be impactful to the present; Gus is spurred to action against rivals; Jesse seeks help from Walt but the results are mixed.

episodes.name: Salud
episodes.summary: The family becomes gravely concerned when Walt doesn't show up for his son's 16th birthday celebration. And Jesse's lab skills are tested in Walt's absence.

episodes.name: Crawl Space
episodes.summary: Walt moves to protect his secret and Gus; Skyler is stymied in her attempt to help Ted with his financial problem.

episodes.name: End Times
episodes.summary: Hank leans on Gomez to explore one final lead, as Walt scrambles to protect his family. Meanwhile, Jesse learns some unsettling news and races to share it with Walt.

episodes.name: Face Off
episodes.summary: The fourth season ends with Walt and Jesse squaring off against Gus. Elsewhere, Walt acquires a surprise confederate with help from Saul.

episodes.name: Live Free or Die
episodes.summary: In the series 5 premiere, Walt deals with the aftermath of the explosion, while Hank wraps up his investigation of Gus and his criminal empire.

episodes.name: Madrigal
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse seek out an unlikely partner for a new business venture. The DEA follows up new leads in its investigation.

episodes.name: Hazard Pay
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse put a business plan into action. Walt confesses a secret to Marie.

episodes.name: Fifty-One
episodes.summary: Walt celebrates another birthday. Skyler considers her options. An associate complicates Walt and Jesse's plan.

episodes.name: Dead Freight
episodes.summary: Walt's team must get creative to obtain the materials they need to continue their operation.

episodes.name: Buyout
episodes.summary: Walt, Jesse, and Mike struggle over the future of their business, as occupational hazards weigh on Jesse.

episodes.name: Say My Name
episodes.summary: Walt takes control of business matters as Mike grapples with the consequences of his actions.

episodes.name: Gliding Over All
episodes.summary: Walt ties up loose ends. Seeing the evidence of his success, he makes a startling and dangerous decision.

episodes.name: Blood Money
episodes.summary: As Walt and Jesse adjust to life out of the business, Hank grapples with a troubling lead.

episodes.name: Buried
episodes.summary: While Skyler's past catches up with her, Walt covers his tracks. Jesse continues to struggle with his guilt.

episodes.name: Confessions
episodes.summary: Jesse decides to make a change, while Walt and Skyler try to deal with an unexpected demand.

episodes.name: Rabid Dog
episodes.summary: An unusual strategy starts to bear fruit, while plans are set in motion that could change everything.

episodes.name: To'hajiilee
episodes.summary: Things heat up for Walt in unexpected ways.

episodes.name: Ozymandias
episodes.summary: Everyone copes with radically changed circumstances.

episodes.name: Granite State
episodes.summary: Events set in motion long ago move toward a conclusion.

episodes.name: Felina
episodes.summary: The acclaimed crime drama comes to a close in the series finale.
